<!-- Generated by Harlequin Webmaker 2.1.3; Transducer 1.0.2 --> <HTML> <HEAD> <TITLE> PacsLab</TITLE> </HEAD> <BODY> <A NAME=HEADING55></A> <A HREF="AR95Book-56.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bnext.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-54.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bprev.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-48.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bup.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Btop.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bcontent.gif"></A><BR><A HREF="AR95Book-56.html">[Next] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-54.html">[Previous] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-48.html">[Up] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html">[Top] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html">[Contents]</A> <P> <IMG SRC="spacer2.gif"><IMG SRC="spacer2.gif"><IMG SRC="pacsRjT.gif"><P> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> <P> The parallel computation and simulation Laboratory (PacsLab) supports research that is experimental and multidisciplinary. The emphasis is on methodologies and tools for seamless, secure, scalable and fault-tolerant concurrent computing on heterogeneous networked computing platforms. Central to this effort is the notion of domain-oriented software support. Current projects include research on threads systems, network protocols, active messaging communications environments, integrated network services, parallel simulation systems and a threads-based MPI. The lab maintains a subnet of four Sun SPARC 5s, a 4-processor SPARC 20, a Silicon Graphics Indigo, and access to a 140-node Intel Paragon via an ATM. The lab was equipped with funding from the Department of computer sciences, NSF, ARO and ONR.<P> <IMG SRC="goldRule.gif" width =100%> <ADDRESS>CS Annual Report - 19 APR 1996</ADDRESS> <A HREF="AR95Book-56.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bnext.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-54.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bprev.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-48.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bup.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Btop.gif"></A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html"><IMG ALIGN = BOTTOM SRC = "Bcontent.gif"></A><BR><A HREF="AR95Book-56.html">[Next] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-54.html">[Previous] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-48.html">[Up] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-1.html">[Top] </A><A HREF="AR95Book-2.html">[Contents]</A> <P> </BODY> </HTML> </HTML>
